content.text:
# King Ai of Zhou

|p2=Zhōu Āi Wáng |w2=Chou Āi-wangKing Āi of Chou |l2=The Lamentable King of Zhou
}}
King Ai of Zhou () personal name Ji Quji, was a king of China's Zhou dynasty. He was the eldest son of King Zhending.
He succeeded his father in 441 BC, but was killed by his younger brother, Shuxi (King Si), after only three months on the throne.
See also
#Family tree of ancient Chinese emperors
